page.title: 05A farm worker's day
page.content: At 8 a.m. I tend to the animals on and around the farm. 12 noon to 12.30 p.m. is lunch time. I check all the animals in the fields after 12.30 p.m. to ensure that none of them are missing or injured. From around 2.00 p.m. the time is spent fencing and doing odd-jobs about the farm including the buildings. 5.00 p.m. and I round up the cows for evening milking. { Q.4. Are there any jobs that occur {at special times of the year? A.4. At harvest time the corn has to be cut, whatever type wheat or barley, and the straw has to be cut and bailed for winter bedding for the farm stock.
